# fafbseg

The goal of fafbseg is to provide support for analysis of segmented EM
data, focussed on the [full adult female brain (FAFB)
dataset](http://temca2data.org/).

Although there is support for a range of data sources and services, at
this point the principal target is the [FlyWire](https://flywire.ai/)
automated segmentation. Legacy support also exists for the [Google
brain](http://fafb-ffn1.storage.googleapis.com/landing.md) automatic
segmentation of FAFB data.

**fafbseg** is integrated with the [NeuroAnatomy
Toolbox](https://github.com/natverse/nat) suite (aka
[natverse](http://natverse.org)) including
[elmr](https://github.com/natverse/elmr) and
[catmaid](https://github.com/natverse/rcatmaid).

**fafbseg** is also one building block for the
[coconatfly](https://natverse.org/coconatfly/) which provides a unified
and simplified interface to a range of Drosophila connectome datasets.
We actually recommend [coconatfly](https://natverse.org/coconatfly/) as
a good place to start for most users since it provides convenient access
to specific FlyWire data releases as well as powerful cross-connectome
analyses while requiring minimal configuration. See
<https://natverse.org/coconatfly/articles/getting-started.html> for
details.

## Installation

Assuming you want to use the production (in progress) version of the
FlyWire dataset or to access lower level functionality, then fafbseg is
the way to go. You will need to install the package and then configure
your environment including recording your authorisation token and likely
downloading canned data releases.

### Package installation

We recommend installing fafbseg from GitHub using the [natmanager
package](http://natverse.org/natmanager/):

``` r
# install natmanager if required
if (!requireNamespace("natmanager")) install.packages("natmanager")
natmanager::install(pkgs="fafbseg")
```

### FlyWire setup

Basic steps for setting up to access FlyWire data:

``` r
library(fafbseg)
# record your authorisation token
flywire_set_token()
# install python tools required for some functionality
simple_python()
# fetch canned connectivity *and* cell type data 
download_flywire_release_data()
```

note that at the time of writing (Dec 2023)
[`download_flywire_release_data()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/download_flywire_release_data.md)
targets materialisation 783 of the FlyWire dataset, fetching both
annotations and connectivity information.

## Use

Detailed examples will follow in additional vignettes, but as a first
motivation, this is how to do a connectivity query using precomputed
data.

``` r
library(fafbseg)
dl4df=flytable_meta('DL4.*')
dl4df

dl4out <- flywire_partner_summary2(dl4df, partners = 'out', threshold = 3)
dl4out
```

## Acknowledgements

The fafbseg package enables access to a number of published and many
pre-publication resources. We hope that this will accelerate your
science but we **strongly** request that you ensure that you acknowledge
both the authors of this package and the original data sources to ensure
that we and they can justify this free sharing of code and data.

For use of the proofread and annotated FlyWire dataset, please co-cite:

- [Dorkenwald et al 2023](https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.06.27.546656)
- [Schlegel et al. 2023](https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.06.27.546055)

To acknowledge specific FAFB resources:

- For the FAFB dataset, [Zheng et al Cell
  2018](https://www.cell.com/cell/fulltext/S0092-8674(18)30787-6)
- For the FFN1 autosegmentation, [Li et al bioRxiv
  2019](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/605634v3)
- For the FlyWire autosegmentation, [Dorkenwald et al Nat Meth
  2022](https://%20https://doi.org/10.1038/s41592-021-01330-0) and
  <https://flywire.ai>
- For the Buhmann synaptic connection autosegmentation, [Buhmann et al
  Nat Meth 2021](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41592-021-01183-7)
  - if using the `cleft_score` metric please also cite [Heinrich et al
    2018](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007%2F978-3-030-00934-2_36)
- For the neurotransmitter prediction, [Eckstein et al. 2023
  bioRxiv](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.06.12.148775)

FlyWire coordinate transforms and synapse predictions make use of
infrastructure contributed by Davi Bock, Gregory Jefferis, Philipp
Schlegel and Eric Perlman, supported by NIH BRAIN Initiative (grant
1RF1MH120679-01); additional work including assembling ground truth data
was also supported by Wellcome trust (203261/Z/16/Z).

For the fafbseg package itself, please include a reference to the github
page in your methods section as well as a citation to [Bates et al eLife
2020](https://doi.org/10.7554/eLife.53350) along with the statement:

> Development of the natverse including the fafbseg package has been
> supported by the NIH BRAIN Initiative (grant 1RF1MH120679-01), NSF/MRC
> Neuronex2 (NSF 2014862/MC_EX_MR/T046279/1) and core funding from the
> Medical Research Council (MC_U105188491).

**Thank you!**

# Package index

## Package Help

- [`fafbseg`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/fafbseg-package.md)
  [`fafbseg-package`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/fafbseg-package.md)
  : fafbseg: Support Functions for Analysis of FAFB EM Segmentation
- [`dr_fafbseg()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/dr_fafbseg.md)
  : Print information about fafbseg setup including tokens and python
  modules
- [`choose_segmentation()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/choose_segmentation.md)
  [`with_segmentation()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/choose_segmentation.md)
  : Choose or (temporarily) use a FAFB autosegmentation
- [`simple_python()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/simple_python.md)
  : Simple Python installation for use with R/fafbseg/FlyWire

## Released FlyWire data

Functions for interacting with the public release data of the FlyWire
whole brain connectome. There are many other useful support / lower
level functions but these are probably the key ones for interacting with
release data.

- [`download_flywire_release_data()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/download_flywire_release_data.md)
  : Download FlyWire connectivity and annotations from public release
- [`flywire_partner_summary2()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_partner_summary2.md)
  : Rapid flywire connectivity summaries using cached connectome data
- [`flywire_adjacency_matrix2()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_adjacency_matrix2.md)
  : Fast adjacency matrices based on flywire connectome dumps
- [`flywire_ids()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_ids.md)
  : Flexible specification of flywire ids (including from flytable
  types)
- [`add_celltype_info()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/add_celltype_info.md)
  [`flytable_meta()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/add_celltype_info.md)
  : Fetch flytable cell type information to a dataframe with flywire ids
- [`flywire_sirepo_file()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_sirepo_file.md)
  [`flywire_sirepo_file_memo()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_sirepo_file.md)
  : Read or return path to FlyWire annotations manuscript supplementary
  file

## Neuroglancer URLs

Support for generating/parsing Neuroglancer URLs and interconversion of
with FAFB CATMAID URLs and <https://flywire.ai>

- [`open_fafb_ngl()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/open_fafb_ngl.md)
  : Construct Neuroglancer URL based on 3D location data
- [`ngl_encode_url()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_encode_url.md)
  [`as.character(`*`<ngscene>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_encode_url.md)
  : Encode scene information into a neuroglancer URL
- [`ngl_decode_scene()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_decode_scene.md)
  : Decode and manipulate Neuroglancer scenes (from URLs or JSON blocks)
- [`ngl_segments()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_segments.md)
  [`` `ngl_segments<-`() ``](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_segments.md)
  : Helper function to turn diverse inputs into neuroglancer segment ids
- [`ngl_layers()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_layers.md)
  [`` `ngl_layers<-`() ``](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_layers.md)
  [`` `+`( ``*`<ngscene>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_layers.md)
  [`` `-`( ``*`<ngscene>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_layers.md)
  : Extract and manipulate layers in a neuroglancer scene
- [`ngl_add_colours()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_add_colours.md)
  : Add colours to the neuroglancer scene
- [`ngl_blank_scene()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_blank_scene.md)
  : Return a blank neuroglancer scene based on a specified segmentation
- [`flywire_shortenurl()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_shortenurl.md)
  [`flywire_expandurl()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_shortenurl.md)
  : Shorten or expand neuroglancer URLs
- [`flywire_scene()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_scene.md)
  : Return a sample Neuroglancer scene URL for FlyWire dataset
- [`ngl_annotations()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_annotations.md)
  : Extract annotations from a neuroglancer scene into a dataframe
- [`ngl_annotation_layers()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/ngl_annotation_layers.md)
  : Construct one or more neuroglancer annotation layers
- [`xform(`*`<ngscene>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/xform.ngscene.md)
  : Add a transformation to one or more layers in a neuroglancer scene
- [`voxdims(`*`<ngscene>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/voxdims.ngscene.md)
  : Extract voxel dimensions from a neuroglancer scene

## FlyWire Neurons

Functions for working with neuron ids, coordinate transforms and low
level functions to talk to a graphene (FlyWire) server.

- [`chunkedgraph_token()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_set_token.md)
  [`flywire_set_token()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_set_token.md)
  : Record (and if necessary create) a FlyWire chunkedgraph token
- [`flywire2fafb()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire2fafb.md)
  [`fafb2flywire()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire2fafb.md)
  : Map points between FlyWire v1 and FAFB14 space (xyz nm)
- [`flywire_voxdims()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_voxdims.md)
  [`flywire_nm2raw()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_voxdims.md)
  [`flywire_raw2nm()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_voxdims.md)
  : Handle raw and nm calibrated flywire coordinates
- [`flywire_xyz2id()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_xyz2id.md)
  : Find FlyWire root or supervoxel (leaf) ids for XYZ locations
- [`flywire_rootid()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_rootid.md)
  : Find the root_id of a FlyWire segment / supervoxel.
- [`flywire_latestid()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_latestid.md)
  : Find the most up to date FlyWire rootid for one or more input
  rootids
- [`flywire_islatest()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_islatest.md)
  : Check that one or more FlyWire root ids have not been further edited
- [`flywire_last_modified()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_last_modified.md)
  : Check when a root id was last edited
- [`flywire_updateids()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_updateids.md)
  : Update flywire root ids to any timestamp using XYZ position or
  supervoxel ids
- [`flywire_leaves()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_leaves.md)
  : Find all the supervoxel (leaf) ids that are part of a FlyWire object
- [`flywire_change_log()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_change_log.md)
  : Summarise edits for one or more FlyWire segment ids
- [`flywire_fetch()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_fetch.md)
  : GET/POST from flywire (graphene) servers with appropriate
  authorisation token
- [`flywire_cloudvolume()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_cloudvolume.md)
  : Low level access to FlyWire data via Python cloudvolume module
- [`flywire_l2ids()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_l2ids.md)
  : Return level 2 supervoxel ids for neurons

## FlyWire Synapses

Functions for working with predicted synapses/neurotransmitters for
FlyWire neurons

- [`flywire_partners()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_partners.md)
  [`flywire_partner_summary()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_partners.md)
  : Find the input/output partners for a flywire neuron
- [`flywire_adjacency_matrix()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_adjacency_matrix.md)
  : Fetch the synaptic adjacency matrix for a set of flywire neurons
- [`flywire_ntpred()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_ntpred.md)
  [`print(`*`<ntprediction>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_ntpred.md)
  : Return raw neurotransmitter prediction results for output of flywire
  neuron
- [`flywire_ntplot()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_ntplot.md)
  [`flywire_ntplot3d()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_ntplot.md)
  : Plot neurotransmitter prediction summaries or synapses in 3D
- [`flywire_dcvs()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_dcvs.md)
  : Get predicted dense core vesicle locations in the flywire dataset
- [`flywire_neurons_add_synapses()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_neurons_add_synapses.md)
  [`flywire_synapse_annotations()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_neurons_add_synapses.md)
  : Attach synapses to flywire neuron skeletons
- [`braincircuits_register()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/braincircuits_login.md)
  [`braincircuits_login()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/braincircuits_login.md)
  [`braincircuits_token()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/braincircuits_login.md)
  : Create and log into a braincircuits account
- [`flywire_connectome_data()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_connectome_data.md)
  [`flywire_connectome_data_version()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_connectome_data.md)
  : Access precomputed flywire connectivity data

## FlyWire Annotations

Functions for working with FlyWire’s own Connectome Annotation
Versioning Engine which is the backend handling all annotations
including synapses for FlyWire and other projects. Alternatively we have
our own more flexible flytable system.

- [`flywire_cave_client()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_cave_client.md)
  : Low level access to the Flywire CAVE annotation system
- [`flywire_cave_query()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_cave_query.md)
  : Query the FlyWire CAVE annotation system
- [`flywire_timestamp()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_timestamp.md)
  : Find standard UTC timestamp for flywire materialisation version or
  timestamp
- [`flywire_user_info()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_user_info.md)
  : Fetch information for one or more users
- [`flywire_nuclei()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_nuclei.md)
  [`flywire_nearest_nuclei()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flywire_nuclei.md)
  : Queries for information about flywire nuclei (helpful for finding
  somata)
- [`flytable_login()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_login.md)
  [`flytable_set_token()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_login.md)
  [`flytable_base()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_login.md)
  [`flytable_alltables()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_login.md)
  [`flytable_columns()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_login.md)
  : Low level functions to access the flytable metadata service
- [`flytable_list_rows()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable-queries.md)
  [`flytable_query()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable-queries.md)
  : Flytable database queries
- [`flytable_update_rows()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_update_rows.md)
  [`flytable_append_rows()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_update_rows.md)
  [`flytable_nrow()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_update_rows.md)
  : Update or append rows in a flytable database
- [`flytable_list_selected()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_list_selected.md)
  : List selected rows from flytable
- [`tabify_coords()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/tabify_coords.md)
  : Convert coordinates to tab separated values. Useful for copy/paste
  to Seatable
- [`flytable_cell_types()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_cell_types.md)
  : Fetch (memoised) flywire cell type information from flytable
- [`flytable_set_celltype()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/flytable_set_celltype.md)
  : Set the flytable cell type and other columns for a set of root ids
- [`cam_meta()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/cam_meta.md) :
  Return neuron metadata from Cambridge seatables
- [`fct2nginfo()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/fct2nginfo.md)
  : Convert flytable cell type information into a neuroglancer info file
- [`write_nginfo()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/write_nginfo.md)
  : Read and write neuroglancer annotation info json files

## FlyWire Meshes and Skeletons

Functions for working with FlyWire neurons as meshes or skeletons

- [`save_cloudvolume_meshes()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_cloudvolume_meshes.md)
  [`read_cloudvolume_meshes()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_cloudvolume_meshes.md)
  : Read meshes from chunked graph (graphene) server via CloudVolume
- [`read_l2skel()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_l2skel.md)
  [`read_l2dp()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_l2skel.md)
  : Read L2 skeleton or dotprops for FlyWire data sources using
  fafbseg-py
- [`meshparty_skeletonize()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/meshparty_skeletonize.md)
  : Skeletonize neurons using meshparty python library
- [`skeletor()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/skeletor.md)
  [`reroot_hairball()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/skeletor.md)
  [`download_neuron_obj()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/skeletor.md)
  : Skeletonise neuron meshes using skeletor
- [`fafb14_to_flywire_ids()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/fafb14_to_flywire_ids.md)
  : Get flywire IDs that map onto CATMAID neurons

## Neuroglancer - CATMAID interconversion

High level approach to converting URLs, neurons etc to representations
based on Neuroglancer / brainmaps data

- [`catmaid2ngl()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/catmaid2ngl.md)
  : Convert CATMAID things (eg neurons) into Neuroglancer equivalents

## FAFB FFN1 segmentation skeletons

Read FAFB FFN1 segmentation skeletons (Peter Li, Google) from packaged
zip files or over the web via brainmaps API.

- [`read_segments()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_segments.md)
  [`read_segments2()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_segments.md)
  : Read skeletons for segments by extracting from the corresponding zip
  file(s)

- [`read.neuron.brainmaps()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read.neuron.brainmaps.md)
  [`read.neurons.brainmaps()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read.neuron.brainmaps.md)
  :

  Read skeleton(s) from brainmaps API into a
  [`nat::neuron`](https://rdrr.io/pkg/nat/man/neuron.html) object

- [`read_topn()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_topn.md)
  [`find_topn()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_topn.md) :
  Find and read the largest n segments from one or more skeleton zip
  files

- [`skelsforsegment()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/skelsforsegment.md)
  : Find all skeleton fragments for one segment

- [`swc2segmentid()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/fafbseg-ids.md)
  [`segmentid2zip()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/fafbseg-ids.md)
  [`zip2segmentstem()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/fafbseg-ids.md)
  : Convert between filenames and neuroglancer ids

## FAFB-FFN1 segmentation agglomeration (merge) information

These functions provide support for loading/using information from the
agglomeration runs that identify candidate merge locations between
indiviual raw segment objects. Some of these merge groups can contain
hundreds or even thousands of segments. Most of the time you will only
need find_merged_segments().

- [`find_merged_segments()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/find_merged_segments.md)
  : Find all merged segment ids for a given starting google segment id
- [`read_mergeinfo()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_mergeinfo.md)
  : Read CSV files containing raw agglomeration (merge) information
- [`make_merge_graph()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/make_merge_graph.md)
  [`merge_graph_components()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/make_merge_graph.md)
  : Graph representation of the agglomeration (merge) between raw
  segments
- [`find_merged_segments_slow()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/find_merged_segments_slow.md)
  : Find all merged segment ids for a given starting google segment id

## Brainmaps API

Authentication and queries to the Google brainmaps API (what
Neuroglancer talks to under the hood to get image data, segmentation
etc).

- [`brainmaps_auth()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/brainmaps_auth.md)
  : Generate a token to enable access to brainmaps API
- [`brainmaps_fetch()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/brainmaps_fetch.md)
  [`brainmaps_clear_cache()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/brainmaps_fetch.md)
  : GET/POST from brainmaps API with optional retry / cache
- [`brainmaps_xyz2id()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/brainmaps_xyz2id.md)
  : Convert 3D x,y,z locations in brainmaps volumes to segmentation ids
- [`brainmaps_listfragments()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/brainmaps_listfragments.md)
  : Low level call to brainmaps API to list mesh fragment ids for
  segment ids
- [`brainmaps_skeleton()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/brainmaps_skeleton.md)
  : Low level function to fetch skeleton from brainmaps API
- [`read_brainmaps_meshes()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_brainmaps_meshes.md)
  : Read 3D meshes via the brainmaps API
- [`brainmaps_volume()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/brainmaps_volume.md)
  : Extract brainmaps volume identifier

## Low level support for Neuroglancer segment meshes

Functions for loading/processing/visualising 3D mesh (wireframe)
information displayed in Neuroglancer. These are low level functions for
working with raw Neuroglancer data. End users may be interested in
`compare_ng_neuron` but otherwise are unlikely to use these.

- [`compare_ng_neuron()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/compare_ng_neuron.md)
  : Compare a neuroglancer mesh object with a regular neuron
- [`fetch_all_curl()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/fetch_all_curl.md)
  : Fetch data specified by a set of curl shell commands (e.g. from
  Chrome)
- [`read_ng_dump()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_ng_dump.md)
  : Read neuroglancer data dump from disk / web
- [`read_ng_raw()`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/read_ng_raw.md)
  : Read raw neuroglancer data - currently only supports mesh format
- [`as.mesh3d(`*`<ng_raw>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/as.mesh3d.md)
  [`as.mesh3d(`*`<ng_raw_list>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/as.mesh3d.md)
  : Convert a raw neuroglancer mesh into a mesh3d object
- [`xyzmatrix(`*`<ng_raw>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/xyzmatrix.md)
  [`xyzmatrix(`*`<ng_raw_list>`*`)`](https://natverse.org/fafbseg/reference/xyzmatrix.md)
  : Extract the XYZ coordinates from neuroglancer mesh objects

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [Accessing the chunked graph
